_comment: Created by ianb on 20/03/2015 10:34:41 using v2.5
title: What number of written complaints have been received, upheld and in relation to what services?
analysis_commentary:
The number of Hospital and Community Health Services (HCHS) complaints has been increasing since 2011/12. Between 2012/13 and 2013/14 there was an increase by 4.6% (4,992 complaints) and 49.9% of complaints were upheld. The largest increase can be seen for NHS Direct with 87.6% but this is based on small numbers. It is followed by Community Hospital Services and Ambulance Services, with 52% and 28.9% increase respectively. The largest decrease was for other community health services with 8% less complaints in 2013/14. Over the years the largest number of complaints has been received in Inpatient and Outpatient Hospital acute services, followed by Mental Health Services.

Most complaints are received in the subject area 'All aspects of clinical treatment' with 52,330 complaints (45.6%) in 2013/14, a 5.5% increase since 2011/12. The next two largest subject areas in 2013/14 were complaints for 'Attitude of staff' (13,269) and 'Communication / information to patients (written and oral)' (11,472).

The total number of Family Health Services (FHS), including GP and dental, was 60,564 in 2013/14. The data is not comparable with previous years (see notes).
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Data on written complaints
